name: Thucydides
what_did:
Thucydides wrote about the long war between Athens and Sparta.
He used facts and his own experience as a general to tell the story.
He wanted to explain why wars happen and how people make decisions.
why_matters:
Thucydides wrote careful, serious history.
He helped people think about cause and effect in war and politics.
His ideas still help us understand power and leadership.

questions.q: What war did Thucydides write about?
How did Thucydides learn about the war?
options: He was a soldier in it

fun_fact: Thucydides caught the plague while writing — and survived it!
